title: Shelly RGBW2
body: Hello, my Shelly RGBW2 is only recognized as a dimmer, unfortunately you can't select or change colors. Everything is available in Homeassistant
author: marioir2001

comments.body: Share the state of the light from Home Assistant's Developer Tools. The bridge will expose color controls if the home assistant entity reports support for HS, RGB or XY color modes.

This shows me the developer tools under status when the Shelly RGBW is turned on.

```
effect_list:
  - "Off"
  - Meteor Shower
  - Gradual Change
  - Flash
supported_color_modes:
  - rgbw
effect: "Off"
color_mode: rgbw
brightness: 255
hs_color:
  - 315.059
  - 100
rgb_color:
  - 255
  - 0
  - 191
xy_color:
  - 0.477
  - 0.196
rgbw_color:
  - 255
  - 0
  - 191
  - 0
friendly_name: Regalbeleuchtung
supported_features: 36
```

Was the device turned on, when the bridge started?

Or asking differently, does it have `hs_color: null` when turned off?

The device was turned off when it was added to the bridge.

the developer tools show me the following when the Shelly is turned off

```
effect_list:
  - "Off"
  - Meteor Shower
  - Gradual Change
  - Flash
supported_color_modes:
  - rgbw
effect: null
color_mode: null
brightness: null
hs_color: null
rgb_color: null
xy_color: null
rgbw_color: null
friendly_name: Regalbeleuchtung
supported_features: 36
```

I just removed the Shelly from the bridge again. Turned the Shelly on and added it back to the bridge.

Now it is displayed as ExtendedColorLight (0x010d)

But even if the Shelly is off, the bridge should recognize it as ExtendedColorLight (0x010d).
Of course!

title: One hour difference in the log
body:
Hello,

I notice that the logs have an hour difference compared to the real time in France.
For example, the log indicates 8:00 a.m. when it is 9:00 a.m.

 Add-on version: 3.0.0-alpha.66
 You are running the latest version of this add-on.
 System: Home Assistant OS 14.2  (aarch64 / raspberrypi4-64)
 Home Assistant Core: 2025.1.4
 Home Assistant Supervisor: 2024.12.3

Thank in advance
author: PtiBed0

comments.body:
The time is shown in UTC (+00:00).
This is indicated by the "Z" at the end.

In general "Z" is equal to "+00:00".

> The time is shown in UTC (+00:00). This is indicated by the "Z" at the end.
> 
> In general "Z" is equal to "+00:00".

Ok Thanks for the clarification

title: Unable to connect to home assistant with url
body: I'm getting stuck after adding a bridge with the message "Unable to connect to home assistant with url". I am using https. Is that not supported? I have no problem to access the url with url from the same machine. The matter bridge is running in docker and not on the same host as Home Assistant.
author: Jost80

comments.body:
Are you using a self signed certificate with HTTPS?

JUST FOR TESTING PURPOSE:
Can you add this environment variable `NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED=0`
This will disable TLS verification.

NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED=0 works. Thank you.

I am using a certificate from my own internal PKI.

Using that variable IS NOT RECOMMENDED. It actually makes the whole purpose of SSL useless.
This was just to verify that it's caused by the self signed certificate.

Actual solution:
we should tell the app that there is a self signed certificate we want to trust. We can use the public key of your HA for that, or the root public key of your CA if available.

You could mount the public key somewhere into the docker container (e.g. `/ssl/public-ha.pem`).
And then add an environment variable: `NODE_EXTRA_CA_CERTS=/ssl/public-ha.pem`

Please tell me if that worked.

Looks like NODE_EXTRA_CA_CERTS=/cert/ha-cert.pem works if ha-cert.pem contains both intermediate and root CA certificates.

All devices are listed as offline in google home though but thats probably something else. Tried with NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED=0 again and still offline.
Yes that's a different problem: #485

title: When restarting, the Names of devices in the Alexa App will be reset
body:
Awesome project, i just installed it and i'm pretty happy with it.

However i have the problem that the names of devices will be changed back to the names assigned in home assistant. For example i have a smart plug called "living room TV" in home assistant that i want to name just "TV" in alexa. However, if i restart the bridge, the name is "living room TV" after that and the group i assigned in the alexa app is gone. On Homekit this is no issue, the names and rooms persist after a restart of HAMH. 
Is there a way to fix this?
author: drBeam

comments.body:
Which version of the addon are you currently running?
There was a bug that caused Alexa to find all devices as "new devices" everytime the addon restarts - this should be fixed with the latest version.
I'm on alpha40 and my Apple Home lost all its customisations again.
I‘m running Alpha38. I will test it with 40 tomorrow and let you know the results. :)
Just checked it, seems to be fixed in Alpha40. Amazing!

title: Not getting notification to update the addon to 3.0.0 alpha 37 or 38
body: My current version is 3.0.0 alpha 36, why am I not getting notification to update the addon to 3.0.0 alpha 37 or 38?
author: datvista

comments.body:
Addon version 37 was broken, so i deleted it before anyone installed it.
Version 38 was just released some minutes ago - Home Assistant doesn't check updates every second, but on a regular basis. Every several minutes - i dont know the exact schedule.
Thank you

author: librehat

comments.body:
Unfortunately Matter forces me to set a target temperature. If this is null, it is autoamtically defaulted to `20 °C`.
I'll add a another check to not allow changing the target temperature if the device is off. At least this is what Alexa is doing, too.

Can you please validate if your controller (e.g. Goggle Home or Apple Home) has a similar behavior? Can you set temperature when the device is off?

My controller is SmartThings, and yes I can confirm that it does let me set the heating temperature when it's off.

Another issue that I noticed is that I see both settings for heating and cooling, which seems wrong as there is no cooling capability in this thermostat.

Can you please post the debug logs when the device is off and you change the temperature.
I need to know if its first turned on and then the temperature is set, or if only the "set temperature" command is called.

Regarding the wrong "cooling" capability: this is related to "auto" mode. in matter "auto" requires both "cooling" and "heating". i still need to figure out, what to do.

Thanks for the fix. I can confirm now that the device seems to stay in the "off" state.

title: [Bug] Brightness is changed to 100% when turning lights on
body: I am using docker container and Amazon's Alexa. Every time I turn on one light connected through home-assistant-matter-hub to Alexa, the old brigthness setting is changed to 100%.
author: casimoes03

comments.body:
actually i am not really sure, why this should happen...
when asking alexa to "turn on the light" it makes a request to the matter bridge to turn it on.
This request includes the requested level which i simply use to pass it to home assistant.

To sum it up, it looks like that alexa is intending to turn it on to 100%.

Does it work, if you ask "set the light to 60%" ?
